newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia to veto British U.N. draft on Iraq - agency.
newsitem.headline: Russia to veto British U.N. draft on Iraq - agency.

text.p: Moscow will veto a British draft resolution condemning Iraq for its offensive in the north if it is presented to the United Nations Security Concil as it is, Deputy Foreign Minister Vasily Sidorov said on Thursday.
"If they (Britain) do this they will get a veto," Interfax news agency quoted Sidorov as saying.
Russia strongly denounced U.S. air strikes launched against Iraq on Tuesday and Wednesday in retaliation to Baghdad's military operation against separatist Kurds in the north.
Russia has described U.S. action as an "inappropriate" raction and demanded that all military actions in the regions are stopped.
Russia's ambassador to the United Nations Sergei Lavrov on Wednesday condemned the British draft, saying Russia could not support the latest version.
Russia and the other four permanent members of the Security Council -- the United States, France, Britain and China -- have a right to veto any decision by the top U.N. body.
